intro: Ixora bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. Ixora bidentata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun.
